result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Haws was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 3 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A Haws

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory A Haws in court.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State has extended an offer to the deft at the pre-trial.
State moves to amend the charge to an Ordinance DC violation.
Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
$50+cc, pp $25/mo beg 1-1-16, ftp 3 days RCJ for contempt.

Pre-trial conference at 10-08-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 11-09-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, MM and JK (person, property, residence or family).   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Gregory A Haws in court.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
